pageContext.claim: “Going up fast. We need the Wall more than ever!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is using the covid-19 outbreak to justify his push for a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, even though the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and other public-health experts say they haven't seen evidence it can stop the virus from spreading. But none of the coronavirus cases reported in the United States have been linked to people who entered through the U.S.-Mexico border. Hours after this tweet, Rep. Katherine M. Clark (D-Mass.) asked at a House hearing whether “structural barriers at our border would be of any use in mitigating the outbreak of this virus.” CDC Director Robert Redfield responded: “Not that I've seen."
